com.tectonica.jonix.extract

Class JonixUniqueExtractor<H,P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tectonica.jonix.stream.JonixExtractor
      • com.tectonica.jonix.stream.JonixFilesExtractor
        • com.tectonica.jonix.extract.JonixUnifiedExtractor<H,P>
          • com.tectonica.jonix.extract.JonixUniqueExtractor<H,P>

  • public class JonixUniqueExtractor<H,P>
extends JonixUnifiedExtractor<H,P>
    This extractor accumulates (in memory) the products it receives during streaming. When getUniqueProducts() is called, it filters the accumulated products so as to leave only one per product-ID. The chosen one is the first in the sort order, which can be customized by the caller. Also, the very definition of what constitutes the product's ID is also determined by the caller.

    NOTE: sources that are read as InputStreams via JonixStreamer.read(java.io.InputStream, String) will not enter the list. It is only intended for files (whose name and modification-time are crucial for the filtering)

    Author:
    Zach Melamed

      java.util.List<com.tectonica.jonix.extract.JonixUniqueExtractor.ProductInfo<H,P>> getUniqueProducts()
      Returns a filtered list of products, that includes - for each product-ID - only the one with the latest time-stamp (as extracted from its file name or modification-time)

      Returns a filtered list of products, where each product-ID appears once

      • getUniqueProducts

        public java.util.List<com.tectonica.jonix.extract.JonixUniqueExtractor.ProductInfo<H,P>> getUniqueProducts(java.util.Comparator<com.tectonica.jonix.extract.JonixUniqueExtractor.ProductInfo<H,P>> comparator)
        Returns a filtered list of products, where each product-ID appears once
        Parameters:
        comparator - a custom Comparator for ordering products with identical IDs. Among all such products, the one that compares to be the 'smallest' will be picked when the list is filtered
        Returns:
